com.tsgrp.migration.event

Class ConvertContentToPDFListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.event.AbstractListener
      • com.tsgrp.migration.event.ConvertContentToPDFListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SourceEndExportNodeEventListener, TargetBeginImportNodeEventListener

    public class ConvertContentToPDFListener
extends AbstractListener
implements SourceEndExportNodeEventListener, TargetBeginImportNodeEventListener
    Converts the node's content to the PDF format and sets the new content, name, extension and mimetype on the node.

      Injected (optional): PDF/A Format - determines whether or not to create the PDF in PDF/A-3b compliance (true) or not (false); defaults to false.

      Injected (optional): Scale Images - determines whether or not to scale the PDF images when stitched together in the ImageAssembler#imageToPdf method; defaults to true.

        public void setCreatePdfInMemory(boolean createPdfInMemory)
        Injected, (optional): boolean indicating that the program should create the pdf in memory and not to a file. If this is not set, the pdf will always be created as a file.

      • setUseOMExtension

        public void setUseOMExtension(boolean value)
        Injected, OPTIONAL. Defaults to false. If true, will evaluate om_extension instead of using FilenameUtils to determine the node's extension.

      • setSetExtensionOnName

        public void setSetExtensionOnName(boolean value)
        Injected, OPTIONAL. Defaults to true. If false, will not include the extension in the node's om_name.
        Parameters:
        {boolean} - whether or not to add the extension to om_name

      • quietlyDeleteFile

        public boolean quietlyDeleteFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Delete the file indicated, but do not throw an exception if anything at all goes wrong (blank filename, file didn't already exist, file could not be deleted, file was not deleted even though we think it should have been, or any Throwable is caught).
        Parameters:
        fileName - - the PDF filename to delete
        Returns:
        true if the file was actually deleted
